general_advisory: In view of prolong dry period condition over the district, farmers are advised to provide one life saving irrigation to the standing crops like green gram, black gram, chick pea, groundnut, field pea, maize etc. to avoid water stress condition. Farmers are advised to complete weeding followed by earthing up operation in rabi crops. Apply top dressing during earthing up operation followed by irrigation as needed. Install yellow sticky trap @ 8 /acre to monitor sucking pest complex like White fly, Aphids, Jassids & Thirps in vegetative stage of the crop.

advisory: Nutrient Management: In direct seeded rice apply urea @ 24 kg /acre as fist top dressing at 20 -25 DAS. Apply DAP 44 kg + MOP 22 kg per acre as basal dose during final puddling in case of transplanted paddy.

Pest Management: Rust: Prevailing weather condition favours the development of rust disease. To control spray, Chlorothalonil 75% WP @ 400g/acre or Difenoconazole 25% EC @ 200ml/acre mixed with 200 liters of water.

Pest Management: Yellow Mosaic Virus: In Prevailing weather condition YMV is transmitted through white fly. If symptom is noticed, remove infected plants from the field. Install yellow sticky traps @ 8nos/acre to monitor pest population and apply neem oil-based pesticide Azadiractin 0.03% ( 300 ppm) @ 5ml/ltr of water at initial stage of infestation.

Pest Management: Tikka: If symptom is noticed, application of Chlorothalonil 75% WP @ 400g/ac or Hexaconazole 5% EC @ 300 ml/ac or Mancozeb 75% WP @ 600 g/ac mixed with 200 liters of water is recommended.

Pest Management: Mustard Aphid: In prevailing weather condition infestation of mustard aphid may be seen. Install yellow sticky trap @ 8nos/acre to monitor pest population. Apply Imidacloprid 17.8% SL @ 4ml or Thiamethoxam 25% WG @ 3g or Chlorpyriphos 20% EC @ 15 ml by mixing with 15 liters of water when symptom is noticed.

Pest Management: Powdery mildew: Infestation of powdery mildew may happen in prevailing weather condition. Spray Propiconazole 25% EC @ 1 ml/ltr or Triademefon 25% WP @ 1g /ltr of water as control measure. Capitulum Borer: Spray Bacillus thuringiensis var kurstaki 5% WP @ 1.5 g/ltr of water. Head Rot: Spray 0.4% Copper oxychloride 50% WP @ 3g/ltr of water to control head rot disease.

Irrigate the crop at 10 days interval considering dry weather condition. Nutrient Management: After hoeing and weeding, apply 45kg Urea as first top dressing at 4-week stage followed by irrigation. After hoeing and weeding, apply 23kg Urea as second top dressing at 6 to 7-week stage followed by irrigation.

Pest Management: Fruit & Shoot borer: Install pheromone trap @ 8nos/acre to monitor pest population. For chemical control, spray or Flubendiamide 39.35% SC @ 3 ml Cyntranliprole 10.26% OD @ 30ml or Thiamethoxam 12.6% + Lambda -cyhalothrin 9.5% ZC @ 4ml or Indoxacarb14.5% SC @ 15 ml mixed with 15 liters of water. Leaf curling/White fly: Leaf curling may notice due to white fly infestation. Install yellow sticky trap @ 8nos/acre to monitor pest population. For chemical control, spray Dimethoate 30% EC @ 20 ml or Cyntranliprole 10.26% OD @ 30ml or Thiamethoxam 12.6% + Lambda -cyhalothrin 9.5% @ 4ml or Indoxacarb14.5% SC @ 15 ml mixed with 15 liters of water.
Pest Management: White fly: Install yellow sticky trap @ 8 -10/acre or spray Neem Based Pesticide (Azadirachtin) 1500 PPM @ 3ml/ltr of water at initial stage of infestation.
Powdery mildew: In prevailing weather condition infestation of Powdery mildew may notice in Rose plant. Spray Carbendazim 50% WP @ 2g/ltr of water as preventive measure.
Inflorescence rot: To control inflorescence rotting in Merigold spray Mancozeb 75% WP @ 2g or Carbendazim 50% WP @ 1g by mixing with one liter of water.
